result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Margaret Schmit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: to any sentence defendant is serving.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
$518 court costs imposed in 22CF194 shall be paid as a condition of probation in 22CF88 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain a stable residence.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall have no contact with Washington County Hobby Lobby Stores or the Canna Bloom Farmacy.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Margaret Schmit

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melissa Margaret Schmit in court in custody and by Attorney Timothy Drewa.  Cases called:  22CF88 & 22CF194.  Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty pleas entered.

Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melissa Margaret Schmit in court in custody and by Attorney Timothy Drewa.  Cases called:  22CF88 & 22CF194.  Resolution reached.  State is in compliance with victim rights.  State moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 1 and 3 of 22CF88 and Ct. 1 of 22CF194 and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 2.  Court finds defendant guilty on Ct. 2.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Timothy Drewa in person.  Defendant has new charges pending in Branch 4 in 22CF194. Atty. Drewa is working on consolidation.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Melissa Margaret Schmit in court.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Melissa Margaret Schmit. Information on file; reading waived; NG PLEAS entered. Anticipated this case would resolve with 21CF483 but has not. Case returned to Br 3 for further proceedings. Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Melissa Margaret Schmit in court and by Attorney Timothy Drewa.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Atty. Drewa requests this case tag with 21CF483 (Branch 2 case).  Arraignment scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
22R 004529 Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #14552 on 3/2/22
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with Hobby Lobby in Washington County. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Andrew Leech.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.   Argument on bond.  $1,000 cash bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with Atty. Drewa and for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
